verses.roman:
aiśvarya-jñāne vidhi-bhajana kariyā
vaikuṇṭhake yāya catur-vidha mukti pāñā

synonyms: aiśvarya-jñāne—in knowledge of the opulences; vidhi—according to rules and regulations; bhajana—worship; kariyā—doing; vaikuṇṭhake—to Vaikuṇṭha; yāya—they go; catuḥ-vidha—four kinds; mukti—liberation; pāñā—achieving.
translation: "By performing such regulated devotional service in awe and veneration, one may go to Vaikuṇṭha and attain the four kinds of liberation.
